title.narrative: PLANNING, MONITORING & EVALUATION

description.narrative: Government has improved access to and ability to use child-centred data and evidence, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of CP, equity driven national and local systems, inclusive social sector policies/plans (e.g. cash transfers, etc.) and increased budgets to address disadvantaged children, guided by strengthened knowledge management and advocacy.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government has improved access to and ability to use child-centred data and evidence

description.narrative: UNICEF Monitoring and Evaluation Government Capacity development supported the operationalization of the Government's National Evaluation Policy and Results-Based Management and Reporting policy. For the first time UNICEF also began support of the House of Representatives in evaluation capacity development – helping to bridge the executive and legislative functions of Government. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019
